items: Find a sturdy horizontal bar that can support your weight.
Stand facing the bar and reach up to grab it with an underhand grip (palms facing towards you).
Step back until your arms are fully extended and your body is at a slight angle.
Engage your core and pull your chest towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Strengthens the lower body muscles, including the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and calves
Increases flexibility in the hips and ankles
Helps to improve posture and alignment
Can be modified to target specific muscle groups or accommodate injuries
Can be done with or without weights, making it accessible for all fitness levels
Can be incorporated into a full-body workout routine or used as a standalone exercise
